item.description:
As usual, I'll be on the first floor until about 7pm. I also hope to be wearing the new Visual Art Appreciators button. (See the new meetup image).

Hope to see you there! The hanging nasturtiums are gorgeous.

-Cristin

April 16th, 2009 – Earthly Eden
It’s springtime at the Gardner even if it isn’t outside yet! Explore tantalizing images of the garden throughout the museum as we celebrate our annual Nasturtium display (one of Gardner’s favorite plants!).

* Courtyard Sounds: Relax alongside the court with live classical music from up and coming musicians from New England Conservatory (5:30 to 8:30 PM)
* Gallery Travels: Visit the galleries with this self-guided tour exploring how Gardner incorporated art and landscape into the museum’s spaces.
* Viewfinder: Listen in on a discussion about John S. Sargent’s famous portrait of Isabella Gardner (every half-hour), plus other impromptu gallery discussions (5:30 to 8:30PM)
* Before There Was the Courtyard: Drop in to chat with Museum Archivist Kristin Parker, and get a rare glimpse of photographs showing the Japanese, English, and Italian gardens created by Isabella Gardner at Green Hill, her Brookline estate (6 to 7PM).
* Sketching in the Galleries: Create your own masterpieces with drawing in the cloisters and galleries (6 to 9PM)
* Artful Flavors: Indulge in the culinary arts, signature cocktails including the all-new Madame Gautreau, and more at the courtside bar and Gardner Café.
item.how_to_find_us: I'll be wearing a bright pink/purply scarf and a new VAA button!
